trans-unit.source: Redefines the current path as the area that would be painted if the path were stroked

seg-source.mrk: Redefines the current path as the area that would be painted if the path were stroked

target.mrk: Redefines the current path as the area that would be painted if the path were stroked

trans-unit.source: Handle to a device context that contains a closed path.

seg-source.mrk: Handle to a device context that contains a closed path.

target.mrk: Handle to a device context that contains a closed path.

trans-unit.source: The device context identified by the $hDC parameter must contain a closed path.

seg-source.mrk: The device context identified by the $hDC parameter must contain a closed path.

target.mrk: The device context identified by the $hDC parameter must contain a closed path.

trans-unit.source: The _WinAPI_WidenPath() function is successful only if the current pen has a width, in device units, of more than one.

seg-source.mrk: The _WinAPI_WidenPath() function is successful only if the current pen has a width, in device units, of more than one.

target.mrk: The _WinAPI_WidenPath() function is successful only if the current pen has a width, in device units, of more than one.

trans-unit.source: Any Bezier curves in the path are converted to sequences of straight lines approximating the widened curves.

seg-source.mrk: Any Bezier curves in the path are converted to sequences of straight lines approximating the widened curves.

target.mrk: Any Bezier curves in the path are converted to sequences of straight lines approximating the widened curves.

trans-unit.source: As such, no Bezier curves remain in the path after _WinAPI_WidenPath() is called.

seg-source.mrk: As such, no Bezier curves remain in the path after _WinAPI_WidenPath() is called.

target.mrk: As such, no Bezier curves remain in the path after _WinAPI_WidenPath() is called.
